text: This is where neurodiversity is important. These films often break rules which ND people rely on to function socially in cultures run by and for neurotypical humans. They also often attempt to maximise or minimise a particular subset of experiences.
tokenized_text: this is where neurodiversity is important . these films often break rules which nd people rely on to function socially in cultures run by and for neurotypical humans . they also often attempt to maximise or minimise a particular subset of experiences .

text: There's no reason to think that all humans experience all of these things in the exact same way.  And this is of course vital for film-makers to understand, as we move (hopefully) into an era in which neurodiversity is recognised as far more normal in societies.  However...
tokenized_text: there ' s no reason to think that all humans experience all of these things in the exact same way . and this is of course vital for film - makers to understand , as we move ( hopefully ) into an era in which neurodiversity is recognised as far more normal in societies . however . <repeated>

text: @Miss_Snuffy May I ask how neurodiversity is being factored into the expectation to smile?  Girls are especially adept at masking emotions and this has resulted in a lifetime of undiagnosed ADHD and associated trauma for myself.  I'd hate to think of future generations going through the same.

text:
Read @personneltoday's article on on the importance of supporting #neurodiversity in the workplace.

text:
Just because a company or NGO use hashtags such as: #neurodiversity #neurodivergence #autismacceptance does NOT mean they are actually advocating for autistic rights.

text: The focus of work within the Neurodiversity Paradigm has broadened beyond Autism to encompass other forms of Neurodivergence. While at the same time the paradigm has increasingly gained footholds in various realms of scholarships, literature, and praises.
tokenized_text: the focus of work within the neurodiversity paradigm has broadened beyond autism to encompass other forms of neurodivergence . while at the same time the paradigm has increasingly gained footholds in various realms of scholarships , literature , and praises .

text: The term Neurodiversity was coined in 1993 by an Autistic Australian sociologist named Judy Singer, and was quickly picked up and extended upon within the Autistic activist community.
tokenized_text: the term neurodiversity was coined in <number> by an autistic australian sociologist named judy singer , and was quickly picked up and extended upon within the autistic activist community .

text:
-m to heal from internalized oppression.

----------------------------------------
|Development|
The Neurodiversity Movement has it's origins in the Autistic Rights Movement that spring up in the 1990's.
tokenized_text: - m to heal from internalized oppression . - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - | development | the neurodiversity movement has it ' s origins in the autistic rights movement that spring up in the <number> ' s .

text:
--------------------------------------------

|In Practice|
‚Ä¢Psychotherapists who integrate the Neurodiversity Paradigm do so by refusing to label neurodivergence as indistinctally(?) pathological.
tokenized_text: - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - | in practice | ‚Ä¢ psychotherapists who integrate the neurodiversity paradigm do so by refusing to label neurodivergence as indistinctally ( ? ) pathological .

text: ‚Ä¢The social dynamics of Neurodiversity are similar to the dynamics that manifest around other forms of human diversity. These dynamics include unequal distribution of social power; conversely, when embraced, diversity can act as a source of creative potential.
tokenized_text: ‚Ä¢ the social dynamics of neurodiversity are similar to the dynamics that manifest around other forms of human diversity . these dynamics include unequal distribution of social power ; conversely , when embraced , diversity can act as a source of creative potential .

text:
|Principles|
‚Ä¢Neurodiversity is an essential form of human diversity. The idea that there is one "normal" or "healthy" type of brain or one "right" style of neurocognitive functioning, is no more valid than the idea that there is one "normal" or "right" gender, race or culture.
tokenized_text: | principles | ‚Ä¢ neurodiversity is an essential form of human diversity . the idea that there is one " normal " or " healthy " type of brain or one " right " style of neurocognitive functioning , is no more valid than the idea that there is one " normal " or " right " gender , race or culture .

text:
The Neurodiversity Paradigm is an emergent paradigm in which neurodiversity is understood to be a form of human diversity that is subject to the same social dynamics as other forms of diversity (including dynamics of power and oppression)

------------------------------------

text:
@stevesilberman @bigthink This is EXACTLY why I object to "neurodiverse" as an adjective.

Neurodiversity refers to a social and political movement that comes out of the disability rights movement. It has a secondary meaning that signifies diversity. But one person being "neurodiverse" is not a thing.

text: Neurodiversity, a term coined by Judy Singer, a sociologist on the autism spectrum, is a viewpoint that brain differences are normal. Someone may be considered neurodivergent if their brain learns, functions or processes differently than the majority of people. https://t.co/adpAuiXYkn

fMRI of an autistic savant's brain (left) VS an NT (neurotical) brain while processing visual stimuli.

text:
Neurodiversity
Today's #PolEdTuesday post is about Neurodiversity.
Neurodiversity is a term used to describe variation in the human brain that may affect sociability, learning, attention, mood and other mental functions. It was first coined in 1998 by sociologist Judy Singer. https://t.co/HwurYgq34a

text:

@pee_zombie @s_r_constantin - "Pathological [...]", "hyper-[...]"
